website_summaries.verdict: A good middle-ground NETGEAR modem that is easy to use and offers faster speeds without being really expensive.
pros: Supports cable internet plans of up to 500 Mbps
Certified to use with Xfinity by Comcast, Cox, Spectrum, and more
cons: Not compatible with cable plans that are bundled with voice services or with AT&T, Verizon, or CenturyLink

customer_reviews.title: Broke down in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke down less than 2 months. Contacted customer support from Netgear, I was told I would have to send my unit back before they send out a replacement. Don't buy this garbage. If your modem breaks down you're going to have to wait at least 3 or 4 weeks before you get another one back. That's a long time now that everything's connected to the internet. I should have read the bad reviews before I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: ImHighAsAKite

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving claims!!!
customer_reviews.text: States that with Charter Spectrum it will accept ALL speeds. I connected this and went through the install. It wouldn't activate. I contact Charter and they activated it but it wouldn't give me the speeds that I'm paying for (400mb/s). They checked the model number and we came to realize that this model only supports UP TO 300 mb/s!!! And I would only get about 100!!!. I connected Charters modem and got over 400. Really upset about the false advertising and the waste of my day! Returning this
customer_reviews.author: Alan.radtke86

customer_reviews.title: If you don't need to use the internet, get this modem/router
customer_reviews.text: This modem/router is the bane of my existence. It fails terribly as a router. Everyday it fails to deliver the internet to me. I'm 3 ft away from it right now righting this review and have had to power cycle it back on and off twice to be able to load this page. I consistently turn off the wifi on my phone and use my cellular service, because this machine is so bad. I live alone in a small 1 bedroom apt and have comcast with 600 Mbps speed coming out of my wall and into this junk. And yet I can't load a page like ever. If you need to use the internet ever, get something else!
customer_reviews.author: jane_doe

customer_reviews.title: CM700 - Netgear says it's 1.4 Gbps, Xfinity only goes up to 300 Mbps on it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CM700 to replace my CM600 when I switched to a higher speed plan (1Gbps) with XFinity. I did my research, XFinity said it was supported, it had 32 channels up and 8 down, NetGear said it would work up to 1.4 Gpbs. Turns out that's only on some ISPs. XFinity doesn't support this modem for anything that fast. I was only getting 300 Mbps up and 6 Mbps down. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Russ B

customer_reviews.title: Grade: C. Been using it for 2 years. Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Nov 2018. We have been using it with Xfinity for about 2 years. About 1/month, my daughter will tell me the "internet is down". The modem crashes and I have to reset it and then it works for another few weeks, and then it would be down AGAIN, and AGAIN, and........AGAIN. I had a Motorola Surfboard before and thought that I would replace it to get faster internet, but it has been less than ideal. I have a lot of Netgear products that work fine. This one has issues. Grade: C.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, but a slow speed fan helps.
customer_reviews.text: The cable modem worked correctly. My previous speed was 100/10 and it was 107/12 with this modem. A bit higher than I am paying for. I did have an issue with several T4 timeout errors (uplink), and since this modem is in an electronics closet, even though it was on an open shelf with plenty of airflow, it got quite hot. I placed a USB fan drawing air through the modem, and cooling it, and noticed the errors dropped considerably. Now I can go days between errors.
customer_reviews.author: DaveNLR

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a few months
customer_reviews.text: After the modem started to lose connectivity repeatedly throughout the day, I called my cable provider. They confirmed it was the modem. I will never buy netgear again. Not because the modem did not last but instead because of their customer service. They say anything to not replace the modem. I had a total of two phone calls each one hour long before they agreed to send a replacement. But they need my old modem back first so unless you don’t want internet in your house you are almost forced to buy a second modem in the meantime. If anyone heard the things I heard on the phone with netgear customer service they would also never buy this brand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Problematic and inconsistent speeds and dropped signals
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to upgrade after increasing my internet to spectrum’s ultimate at 400 mbps. After installing the modem, which was straight forward, I contacted spectrum and registered the modem. Modem speed was initially confirmed at about 400. Soon after though, I noticed my wireless mesh speeds were no where near 400. I got extremely inconsistent results via internet speed checks and the most I would see wirelessly was about 160. Went through a lot of trouble shooting with spectrum and they finally came out and hooked up there modem. Suddenly all the problems and inconsistencies stopped and my wireless mesh was running at 395mbps are the main unit and at about 200 to 250 at the satellite units consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A. Nehlig

customer_reviews.title: Netgear CM700 works good.
customer_reviews.text: After calling my ISP and have them add this to their system it works good. One thing I did notice is a little lagging in download speed. When I had my rental modem, it always kept at 300+ in speed. I did notice that I lost some of the speed and holds at about 150+ through 250+. I expected a little loss as far as speed. Tested with: Speedtest.net Overall it does work fairly well for my needs. I probably will suggest the Net gear cm1000 model though just because their rating of speed is higher.. I am happy so far with performance and hope that as upgrades come available I will regain some of the speed loss.
customer_reviews.author: R.S.G

customer_reviews.title: Set & Forget
customer_reviews.text: I left the wifi rating unchecked because this falls outside the specification of a modem, and the tech support is also left blank because I've not had the need to call them. I've had years of usage with no problems. This modem is one of the modems suggested for the Xfinity service I've signed up for, and I've not regretted buying the device.
customer_reviews.author: rb

customer_reviews.title: A piece of junk modem
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if yo are a Comcast customer. The PUMA chipset drops out daily and requires rebooting. I should have read the reviews before buying this. Don't waste your money, buy something else instead.
customer_reviews.author: S. Remsnyder

customer_reviews.title: CM700 is an awesome modem
customer_reviews.text: Improved my speed dramatically. Was using the provided hitron modem from Spectrum and only pulling in 250mbps wired and 150mbps wifi on their 400mbps plan. Bought the CM700 modem paired with a Netgear AC2300 router. Now im getting 460mbps wired and 360mbps wifi in the fartherest corner in my house. Definitely recommend this modem. No more Lagging in games or latency issues.
customer_reviews.author: robroy

customer_reviews.title: Bought a bad modem never delivered anywhere close to 100mbps. DO NOT WASTE MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: Long story short, Cable modem was bad from day 1. Of you care to read hear is the long story.... My service was 100mbps, but I was getting g 50mbps, so I bought this modem Jan 2019. After install got speeds of 70-75mbps, better and within range for spectrum. This last week started getting 35-40mbps and then 70mbps. Called Spectrum and increased speed to 200mbps, still only got 70mbps with more consistent speed holds, still no where near 200 that I was paying for. Spectrum sent a tech out next day, she tested everything changed fittings on coax etc. Ends up it was the modem, she installed the free modem from Spectrum and now have blazing fast speed of 200+mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Logan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with all Xfinity plans
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ALL OF XFINITY. I just got wifi hooked up and this modem was not on the approved list for me. Despite it being on Xfinity site and printed on the box. Make sure you know for sure which one works with your internet speed package.
customer_reviews.author: irishfan

customer_reviews.title: Puma chip still an issue even when browsing
customer_reviews.text: I had researched and read about the puma chip issue; but I thought it would be fine since I didn't game often. However, the same issues with latency and dropped connections persist even if using low intensity applications like internet browsing. From almost the beginning, this modem has had issues with internet cutting out. I know it's not the router because WiFi signal was still strong and the router was accessible easily. I'm going to buy the C600 that doesn't have the puma chip to see if it's better, but I would highly recommend everyone to stay away from the C700 and all its hardware issues.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Intermittently losing Internet after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews have stated, I started having issues where my Internet access would intermittently go out after a couple months. After 20 minutes the connection would come back up itself, otherwise if I unplug and plug back in the power the Internet would return. I had a Comcast tech visit my home to run tests on the signal in my lines and test other things and they found no issues with the cables or Comcast Xfinity signal. So we narrowed it down to this router. Unfortunately it's too late to return the device since it's out of the Amazon return period.
customer_reviews.author: Jay T.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and TP-Link Wifi 6 AX1500 Smart WiFi Router to replace the Comcast rental modem/router since setting up Pi Hole I can't change DNS settings. I have a 300 Mb/s Download service and the first 5 test's after the super easy set up all average 340 Mb/s. This is amazing and the wifi speeds are better than before also witht he WiFi 6 on my iPhone X. I would highly suggest these two products for anyone who knows what they are doing. I connected to the web browser (192.168.0.1) and changed password and at the end of the set up, the new modem auto-launched the modem activation with xFinity and BOOM complete and ready to rock and roll.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought the CM700 a couple of weeks ago so that I could upgrade my cable service to 400Mbps/unlimited data. Installation at my end went well and my provider (Suddenlink) provisioned my cable connection for 400Mbps without problems. With my PC cabled directly to the CM700 ethernet port, my download data rate to my PC immediately jumped to 400+ Mbps. When I connected my Wi-Fi router to the CM700 and my PC to my Wi-Fi router, my download data rate to my PC dropped down to the 250Mbps range. I need a new Wi_Fi router to keep up with my CM700 cable modem. I have a dual-band router rated at 300Mbps on each band.
customer_reviews.author: D Thies

customer_reviews.title: do not buy intel modems
customer_reviews.text: trash. it literally crashed twice a week replaced with CM1000 and not one problem since. do not waste your money on these intel chip modems
customer_reviews.author: Technologies8

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: For the amount, I'm upset that it didn't last a year.. the tech support guy from my ISP said he would be shocked if it was my modem since I'd only had it a year.. I bought it last April but didn't install it and use it until around August of 2018. Now at the beginning of July 2019, it won't work. I tried everything else to make my internet work including calling tech support at my ISP. The only thing that worked was switching the modem out with a different one and it worked immediately. Wish I could get my $100 back... totally NOT worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Netgear products for a long time. Recently upgraded to an Orbi system in my home and absolutely LOVE it! However, I soon realized that my 5 yr. old Netgear modem wasn't keeping up with my increased speeds (over 200) and was cutting out more frequently than I could deal with. Rebooting it was getting to be a pain. Decided to upgrade the modem with the CM700 and scored a great deal on Prime Day. This was very easy to install and it only took a few minutes on the phone with Spectrum to get it activated. We were back up and running in no time and my speeds/strength are impressive! Love Netgear!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Won't be Added to Xfinity Service
customer_reviews.text: It won't be Added to Xfinity, I have had to order two of them and both didn't work. Both Xfinity and Netgear support said return it and buy another model. This should work as it says on it Xfinity and it is also under Xfinity approved list, so why you guys have no solution?????
customer_reviews.author: Haitham

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: Took a full 8 hours with SUDDENLINK tech support to get it configured. I’m sure it was NOT the fault of the modem since It came highly recommended by a contractor for SUDDENLINK. After 2 months in service, no issues. Don’t forget to take the old modem back immediately since they don’t stop the rental fee until they receive the old one.
customer_reviews.author: rtk11226

customer_reviews.title: Great modem to use.
customer_reviews.text: Lightning fast speed internet connection with no drop. Love this modem. I love how easy it is to connect this right out of the box. The internet connection was live right away. I will definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a modem. It is always better to have a separate modem and router for your internet setup.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Ong

customer_reviews.title: Modem Works Great with our new NETGEAR WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: has worked well last 6 months We have a TV that used 5G for Fire TV Stick, 5G for XBox one, 2.4G for up to 4 phones and (old) notepad, & 5G for a laptop. We had tech support help me set everything up with Modem and new WiFi... They were a great help/ However, I purchased a 4 year warranty to cover both NETGEAR unit with Tech Support for the reason I have a funny feeling we will need further assistance as the Xfinity internet provider, Modem and WiFi Router are updated in times (as usual).
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: NOT Very RELIABLE or DURABLE at ALL
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this modem at all. It was not hard to get setup. I have setup many Access points, Routers, Switches, Networks etc... so I would say my knowledge is above average on the equipment. The PROBLEM with this MODEM is its DURABILITY and RELIABILITY. At least 1-2 times each month - this MODEM needs to be REBOOTED. Additionally, even worse, after buying this BRAND NEW - it only LASTED 7 months. Now the MAX speed coming through the MODEM is 38mbp speed (used to be 180+mbp) tried many resets, restarts) - Put in my OLD SPARE modem and everything running like normal again (using old SB6121). I would NOT RECOMMEND this MODEM
customer_reviews.author: TechDev

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older Surfboard modem that was dropping connection a few times a day with this. So far it's been running for a couple weeks and hasn't dropped signal once. Set up was really easy, just replace connections from older modem with this one and you're good to go. Speeds are consistent and fast. The modem does run a bit hot compared to my older SB modem, but no complaints so far. I have a netgear nighthawk router running in tandem with this and they seem to work well together.
customer_reviews.author: ASan

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a computer. Only phones and tablets. You NEED a router with this modem if you want to have WiFi. Spent hours on the phone trying to get it to work with the xfinity customer service. Useless. Modem showed up on WiFi as an option on my phone but needed a password. Nowhere in the box or on the modem itself is there a network password. Called up Netgear and even after waiting on hold for around 40 mins the problem was fixed in about 10-15 mins. I ended up just having to reconfigure the router for the new modem. Easy once I knew what to do.
customer_reviews.author: abudebbie

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and fast
customer_reviews.text: Switching to Spectrum from AT&T for higher speed and lower monthly cost. Decided to own all of my own equipment instead of renting it from Spectrum. Spectrum promises speeds starting at 400mbps, so I researched for a compatible modem that could handle the speed. I regularly see speeds of 485mbps at the router. Paired this with the Eero Pro wifi router system, and on average get speeds around 420mbps over wifi. Its been running for 6 months now with no hiccups, no resets needed - just keeps humming along!
customer_reviews.author: victor lucas

customer_reviews.title: Optimum customer? Get this
customer_reviews.text: I'm an optimum customer and I finally was fed up paying 10bucks rental fee on my Modem. This is very much PLUG and PLAY. You don't need to know much about technology (If it's not working call Optimum tech support, they'll help), it be hard to mess up the installation of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Moviebuff27

customer_reviews.title: Get this modem!
customer_reviews.text: Have had it in for a couple of years and it works great! Up to a few hundred MB speed, reliable, consistent, etc. Had some latency issues earlier this year and it ended up being the provider. Get this modem if your speed is 500MB or less.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This device worked well for a few months and now will not work for me at all. I have tried another modem that does work but this modem will not provide me with internet at all now. No damage was incurred to the unit, it simply stopped working. I definitely would not recommend since the device cannot be returned after a period greater than 2-3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: I had thought that the several splitters and older age of my home explained the terrible internet speeds we got--now I know it was our ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in combination with Netgear's Nighthawk x6 ac3200 tri-band router. Set up was very smooth, and we no longer need to use a repeater to get signal in a remote part of the house. My laptop used to get maybe 40mbps over Wi-Fi. Now I'm getting more than the 150 mbps my plan guarantees. We've had no lagging in streaming as was common previously, and my son is not getting thrown off of games. I had thought that the several splitters and older age of my home explained the terrible internet speeds we got--now I know it was our terrible equipment all along! Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: F. Korengel

customer_reviews.title: It works well but the stand is atrocious
customer_reviews.text: It worked well right out of the box. (I'm on Comcast. I did need to call them to do whatever they do to make it work.) My complaint is that the built-in stand is weak, much too lightweight, and utterly flimsy. Once you attach the coaxial cable, the modem will move wherever the cable wants it. My modem is doing a permanent wheelie due to the weight of the coax cable. Also, you can't reorient it to lay flat. Very little thought went into the physical design of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: ThisIsn'tMyName

customer_reviews.title: High speed, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I upgraded from a 2in1 system to two separate entities, the modem and the router. This modem works very well, gives me the speed and consistency that I need, and it seems to run very well, despite the heat in my region. My one gripe, and I don't know if it's the router, modem, or my PC, is that 'Windows could not automatically detect this network's proxy settings,' and I don't know how to fix it. I've run the Googled checklist, but as far as I can tell, it all checks out.
customer_reviews.author: AviKerensky

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Modem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based on the reviews and they didn't disappoint. I would recommend this to any customer wanting to upgrade. I'm using this modem with Spectrum service after there modem crashed at least 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Dora B.

customer_reviews.title: Died slowly and painfully over 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This modem worked ok for several months then died slowly, losing latency then intermittently going off. It was a nightmare to diagnose with us thinking it was a Comcast problem then finding many others have had issues with the Intel Puma modems, it’s on do not buy lists and there are class action suits against Intel for these. Why is it still sold? Replaced with a pre-Puma SB6183.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Brown

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say i was initially impressed with this modem. Came fast, easy to install and worked great for all our needs plus our was considerably less than purchasing a modem through our cable company. But after 6 months of use it completely stopped working. The internet would constantly drop out and we would have to reboot it. Then the last week we had zero internet because it kept saying invalid ip address. We had our cable company out and they suggested replacing the modem. We did with an arris and have had zero internet outages since then. Completely dissapointed with this netgear. This should have lasted well beyond 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Keeps losing the signal
customer_reviews.text: I’m working from home in this pandemic season and internet stability is the key but after 6months use this modem keeps losing the signal and I had to reboot whenever it gets frozen which is not good for the work. Decided to buy another modem.
customer_reviews.author: Kyoung

customer_reviews.title: Thing is blistering fast and a cinch to setup
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Easy to setup to existing system as I plugged it in, went to my router and did an auto install, router found and setup the new modem, then hit the internet and Xfinity provisioned the new modem without me having to look for the proper site. Took all of three minutes. I got a one year deal that dropped my monthly from $75 for 80Gbps to $60 for 185Gbps. Thanks Netgear and Xfinity!
customer_reviews.author: Scribby

customer_reviews.title: Faster than your slow ISP "modem"
customer_reviews.text: Ditch the slow "modem" your ISP gives you and opt for this bad boy. We have four apartments all with phones, computers, gaming systems, tablets, watches and streaming devices on one network. Glitchy, slow internet speeds abounded in endless frustration. So we purchased the CM700 hoping that would fix the tortoise issues. It did. We now surf and play in internet heaven rather than purgatory. Worth the price to retain your sanity. And one last thing. . . . . Carol Haskins definitely murdered her husband.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: CM700 works well for my Spectrum 400/20 Mbps connection
customer_reviews.text: While it may be overkill, I decided to get the CM700 for my upgraded 400/20 Mbps Spectrum internet connection. I updated from an Arris modem that maxed out around 225 Mbps. Spectrum had a heck of a time trying to activate the modem though. It took me three support personnel before I got someone with the magic touch who was able to activate it. I suspect the problem was on their end, not with this modem though, from what the support guy told me. So far, so good! I'm enjoying the new speeds and the stability this modem is offering so far.
customer_reviews.author: Juniorverse

customer_reviews.title: Worked with Comcast. No more rental fees.
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of paying equipment rental fees. This modem installed quickly with a 15 min call to internet provider Comcast. Speed test shows performance matches what the rental device was operating at. Paired this modem with a NetGear wireless router and works great. Device will pay for itself in 6 months of not having a rental fee.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from the CM700
customer_reviews.text: Got this modem to replace a DOCIS 2 modem for my Spectrum cable internet connection. Unfortunately i didn't research the CM-700 and see all the exact same disconnects and drop outs that others have experienced. As I understand, it uses an Intel Puma chipset which has been acknowledges to have problems and even a class action lawsuit is in the works. Stay away from this, extremely frustrating POS!
customer_reviews.author: John Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Immediate performance & definite satisfaction!
customer_reviews.text: This unit was the easiest to install that I've ever done. I contacted Suddenlink who added it's MAC to their database, and within minutes I had 1Gbps performance! The LAN ports deliver max speed of somewhere from 850-950+ range regularly, and peaked to the almost 1Gbps promised by Suddenlink! I couldn't be happier! When I researched to find out how to get into it and configure it, I found there was no reason to ... this unit, with the Suddenlink service, needed no configuration! It worked right out of the box! Perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Rich Allcorn

customer_reviews.title: Fine Chunk o' Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Totes dig it. Use it with xfinity service. Wasn't about to get hosed with equipment rental fees. Service alone costs too much. Set this up with my netgear router and have had zero issues. Basically plug n' play. I've used netgear stuff for quite a few years. Never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Wysper

customer_reviews.title: Amazon quality of operations just keeps degrading
customer_reviews.text: I recently had several failures of another brand of cable modem, so spent double to get a NetGear, a quality name, or so I understand. I went out of my way to buy *NEW* and paid the premium to do so, but what I got was obviously someone's hand-me-down. Maybe it would work fine. Who knows? I bought it as a reserve since I am on the last of that other brand. But I ordered *NEW*, and that's what I expected to get, since I don't know when I will actually be putting it into service.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great Overall Modem.
customer_reviews.text: Great product but a pain to get installed. I am not sure if I messed up the installation process or created some sort of bug. I ended up figuring out my problem and now the internet works fine. I noticed a slight increase in performance of our internet but nothing too impactful. At least I know that this has updated hardware compared to my old TP-Link modem.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Netgear scam ring
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for about 7 or 8 months then decided to stop working. I’m an IT guy so I know all the little tricks to keep these things running and nothing works. These things are designed to fail. Tried logging on to the modem directly and it refuses to do so. This thing is actively rejecting all attempts to fix it. Decided to call up tech support and, big surprise, I have to pay them for an “extended warranty” before they would help me. These people know what they are doing and know what scam they are running. Take it from a computer expert, don’t buy netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gestrich

customer_reviews.title: Great connection. Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem because I had recently bought a nighthawk router and put my former Netgear c6300 gateway modem in bridge mode. I kept having upstream channels not getting locked and intermittent drops of my service. I bought this and it took a matter of minutes to connect and setup through my ISP. I did have to call them to initialize, but most of it was done through their online system. I am extremely happy with this purchase and I now have 32 channels of downstream, but only 4 channels of upstream (ISP dilemma) all of them are locked and I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Griffscavern

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-range cable modem CM700
customer_reviews.text: I'd bought this cable modem when I was switching to Xfinity internet service. The installation was very easy. I didn't expect super speed because I didn't sign for the top tier internet plan. I've not touched is since I've hooked it up. It just works. This cable mode has a great price / value ratio. Highly recommended -I can't speak about wifi because I use a separate wifi router for my home network
customer_reviews.author: Eugene F

customer_reviews.title: Life is much easier after this purchase !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had Motorola Arris Surfboard SB6540 Wireless Modem but had so much internet connectivity issues over last few years that I considered switching to ATT Fiber just to get reliable connections. Lots of tech visits and rewiring later (I did have some signal issues which got resolved) still faced the same problem which was concluded to be a Modem issue. So ended up buying Smart Router and this modem and installation were just plug in and connect to my Xfinity app to activate it. Never had connectivity lost in the past month which was every few hours before. Speeds are consistent and work fine with 3-4 devices streaming video at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with Cox service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this modem and it would not connect with Cox. Cox said it was likely a faulty modem. I ordered a replacement, and that one would not work either. I went purchase an Arris surfboard modem from Target, and it connected immediately. My old modem also worked fine just needed an upgrade. Two brand new modems and neither worked.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Roy

customer_reviews.title: Speed changed, optimum service
customer_reviews.text: Major speed issues, I recommend just buying whatever your router already is. With optimum I lost half of my speed, a whopping 150mbps slower than my original arrow modem. Save yourself the trouble and grab the arris 1602 if you want to stop paying that monthly bill. Have a tech coming, will update if speeds improve.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy G

customer_reviews.title: Saves me Money
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace the modem from Comcast. I am now saving $13/mo. for the modem PLUS I bought 3 Roku's and I am using the Xfinity App, so I am saving $10/mo PER box, or $30/mo. + $13/mo. = $43/mo.= $516/year. That's real money. It's easy to install. Just remember, this is NOT a router. You will still need a wireless router on top of this for a WiFi signal. Other than that, by with confidence and stop wasting money on modem rentals!
customer_reviews.author: Jdiesel77

customer_reviews.title: Speedy modem happy home.
customer_reviews.text: This modem is very lightweight and compact. I originally tried a combo modem router thinking it would be easier but this modem could not have been easier to setup and attaching the router a breeze. Now I have more options if WiFi improves, I only need to update the router. Turned in my cable service combo unit and my internet speed has improved by 40%. I am happy and wish I had done this a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Unit Failed after 20 minutes and one power cycle.
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in and registered with my ISP (Optimum) with no issues. Some reviewers have complained about installation instructions, but I found the included Quick Start instructions are very clear and easy to follow. I powered it down using the on/off button and relocated it to it's final position. It doesn't power up, only a brief red LED flash and then nothing. I tried multiple outlets (and verified other devices works on them as well) and used the supplied NetGear power plug. It worked for about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: RooWrangler

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Installed this 2 months ago and since then our internet reception in the house has been spotty. Bought it because we cut the cable and use only streaming. Started having issues about a month in. Had the internet provider to the house and check all connections. Speed coming into the house is fine. But even using ethernet connection to my laptop the speed will randomly drop to below 100mbps. Very frustrating. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: kmcg

customer_reviews.title: Clearly used and DOA. Came in plain white box
customer_reviews.text: Came clearly used in a plain white box. Dirty and obvious wear. Didn't work. Also learned it has a puma chip which is all bad.
customer_reviews.author: family

customer_reviews.title: Great speed from this modem 32-8 channel
customer_reviews.text: Very nice item. Our speed is 150mbs we pay for and we get up to 185mps all over our ranch home that is 2,500 square feet and a large area to cover with no issues and easy to install. Works with Xfinity and only takes a phone call to give the MAC address and to send the signal and activate it. We use ours with the Orbi router and it’s very nice being able to turn kids WiFi’s on and off or use the timers and parental controls.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Easy 10 Minute install
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package this was a piece of cake to install. Upgraded because my old modem was no longer compatible with Comcast speeds. Unplugged the old, plugged in the new, rebooted PC and Wireless router (i plugged in to router not PC like directions say). Visited the Comcast activation site the included information listed and boom 10 minutes later we are streaming and surfing on 4 devices with zero lag!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH SPECTRUM
customer_reviews.text: Had a difficult time setting up when calling spectrum to activate the modem. Modem was on with all green lights lit up and solid, but spectrum representative couldn't see it online on their end so they had sent out a technician. The technician had told me that a lot of customers had problems with this specific modem (Netgear CM700) and that spectrum doesn't support DOCSIS 3.0 that the modem has and now supports DOCSIS 3.1 on their end.
customer_reviews.author: Trinh Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Really beats paying $15 a month rental for cable co’s older, slower, obsolete modem.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t too hard to set up - be patient & read the instructions carefully. Way faster than the wretched, 9 year old modem that my cable co was charging $180 a year rent for (and was very resistant to updating). Sticking me with this slow, old thing seems to be one way that I was essentially being throttled. Be sure to update that creaky old wireless router, too. Get the download speed that you’re paying for!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works with Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: Like a charm. 1. Followed the Quick Set Up Guide 2. Called Spectrum to register the modem with them (gave them model # & MAC from the side of the box) 3. Got talked into a $15 speed bump (100 mega to 400) 4. Plugged in my Eero wireless router, after a two min router re-cycle and bam! Done. Getting fantastic wireless speeds. Mostly 250-350 (again, paying for 400), but also some eye-popping tests as well. 700+ at times! Talking about the 32x8, DOCSIS 3.0
customer_reviews.author: JC O’Connor

customer_reviews.title: Need to keep manually plug unplug
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for a little while. Afterwards locks up from time to time where you have to power cycle. It would be better if the product just hard fails so that you know it died. Here you never know if it is the modem or the internet provider. Cable modems last 6 to 9 months regardless of brand that I tried. I guess it’s the same crappy chipset inside. Just buy the cheapest one since it’s going to die within a year.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lo

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this modem
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Motorola MB7220 8x4 to this one. What a difference it made. I have a family of five and we all use a lot of bandwidth and this smoothed out all the kinks I had. I hear that the CM1000 is the way to go but didn't want to spend that kind of money on it and I'm very pleased with the decision that I made. Also I had no problems at all activating it with xfinity. I never called once. Just follow the instructions in the booklet and you'll be up and running in about 10-15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Storms20

customer_reviews.title: It works! Finally!
customer_reviews.text: Netgear tech support is phenomenal. Cable tech support took 12 separate phone calls and countless hours to get it right. No matter how many times I told them “new equipment & have them the serial number” they did not get it right. Until one person did and then like magic it worked & is still working beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: T. Peacock

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up with Xfinity. Plug and have them start the service. Speeds for the wifi is as it should be (of course this depends on the router as well). It is a bit smaller than I imagined it would be, which is not a bad thing. However, it is a light (weight) unit so when you have the coaxial cable, ethernet, etc. all attached it tends to tip over since it is so light. Would have been great to have a wall mount feature especially since it is so light. This is my only complaint so far.
customer_reviews.author: Hulk12Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: So Far So good
customer_reviews.text: I bought the modem and Orbi RBK23 to ditch the rental modem cost from Comcast. It was all pretty seamless for the most part. I could get it configured through the app so I had to give Comcast a call and they were able to get it configured. We have the 200MB plan and periodic speed tests are confirming that we are getting in the range of 65-200 Mbps depending on where you are in the house and if the device in on the 2.4 or 5Ghz band
customer_reviews.author: Steve Zartman

customer_reviews.title: It's dead!!
customer_reviews.text: Product quit working after 1year and 2 weeks! Will not buy another product from Netgear again!! Will change review if Netgear solves this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tiernan Gene Creamer

customer_reviews.title: 500 not supported
customer_reviews.text: Says it will support up to 500mbps is as I’m being told by cox will not happen only 300 so the advertising of this is a lie. Other wise the modem was easy to install just hate that I paid $100 for something I’m not getting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't rate this because I canceled the order
customer_reviews.text: I really like Netgear products, and this looks like a nice unit, but I canceled the order so I cannot give you any feedback.
customer_reviews.author: tgpifer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Amazon's restocking fees IF the claims made by the seller turn out to be false!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem based entirely on the (now proven false) claim that appeared on the Amazon page, especially the (spell-corrected) claim which appeared in ALL CAPS, "ELIMINATE MONTHLY CABLE MODEM RENTAL FEES - Up to $156 per year," but that is NOT the way it worked ... or rather, DIDN'T work for me! Regardless of the fact that it would NOT WORK as advertised, Amazon had the unmitigated GALL to charge me a RESTOCKING FEE, to return the FALSELY ADVERTISED item! My ISP (WOWWAY) REFUSED to allow me to install the unit BECAUSE it would have reduced the rental fees I pay to WOWWAY every month!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Solid Router. Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not super tech savvy but with a phone call to my cable company I was able to quickly get this router hooked to my modem and running. The signal is good and has improved our internal experience over the router/modem combo we were renting from the cable provider. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KerriK

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, mild concern about heat / power consumption when idle
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, I'm able to max out my 450mbps connection with Comcast/Xfinity. Solid product. I did notice that it ran fairly warm before I had my router set up meaning it was running warm from theoretically 0 bandwidth utilization. Seems to run the same temperature under normal utilization as well, which means it performs fine under normal utilization but might be wasting some power when its idle.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Liebner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Linksys WRT1900ACS Router
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Netgear 300 mbps modem and that was working but we wanted more speed so we bought this one. Installed it and tried every restart and configuration you could try. It simply won't communicate with the router. Not sure why this Netgear modem wouldn't while the other one did. Don't buy if you have the same router I have.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Did we get a bad modem, or is this modem a dud?
customer_reviews.text: This product does not hold a connection. We thought it was the router, so we bought a new router, and it still will not hold the internet... Thought it was overuse from teaching or having students online....then our internet provider started having issues...but once that was cleared up and the remote learning and teaching ended at the beginning of summer....We still continued to have an issue....
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Faster
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and immediately increased my speed. Got tired of paying rental fees but never thought I would see such a dramatic speed increase.
customer_reviews.author: James Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: versatile option to replace rental modems with support from multiple IPS
customer_reviews.text: Install took less then 5 min, speed is max 400+ Mbps, as provided by ISP (Optimum) . So far great option replacing old arris.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Kofman

customer_reviews.title: Great working modem.
customer_reviews.text: When I installed the modem I was fully connected to the net, but it was not functioning. When I contacted my isp to make sure everything was working they notified me to contact NETGEAR as they may need to do "something" to get full function on the net. After contacting NETGEAR they worked through the modem and router registration and full access at great speeds.
customer_reviews.author: D. Libby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install handles about 50 devices
customer_reviews.text: Our old modem was dying and had to be reset almost every week. In addition, we were paying for 150/10 with Comcast, but only received 100/10. After the last reset failed twice in one day, we purchased this new modem. The install was simple, just followed the easy instructions. After reboot, we now get 150+/10+ and have not had to reset the modem after three weeks! So far so great!
customer_reviews.author: Southern Girl

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those purchases that makes me trust both Amazon & xfinity/Comcast more and more. This is a crappy modem that gives me way more problems than I had previously which was very outdated and did not claim to be meant for use with xfinity. I have to reset it all the time. The download speed is all over the place. Don’t waste your patience or $ on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ash2Ash

customer_reviews.title: Poor WiFi Speed
customer_reviews.text: This product states that it will handle up to 500 mbps service. The best I can get is 95.5 mbps download speed. I have troubleshot with Comcast and it appears I am getting the 200 mbps service up to my modem. Still working on the problem from my end. But until I get it resolved this is the review I will give it. Setup was not that easy either.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem
customer_reviews.text: The CM700 modem works great, one time cost instead of a monthly fee that amounted to much more a year than this cost. The modem was easy to setup with the cable company.
customer_reviews.author: K. P.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 months, have to pay for RMA
customer_reviews.text: After just shy of 3 months in service, this modem was dead when I woke up this morning. Connected to battery backup / surge protection, with no other equipment affected. Netgear technical support determined that it was dead & created an RMA... only after the support call ended did I learn that, under the terms of this RMA, I have to pay shipping to send their dead modem back to them in order to obtain a replacement. Again: despite the fact that this equipment failed in less than 3 months. I will never purchase another Netgear product after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: T. S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Much faster than my old modem
customer_reviews.text: Installation was very straight forward with help from the internet provider. My internet was getting too slow and my internet provider recommended me to order a new/better modem. I have seen a significant increase in download speeds and I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Nefi

customer_reviews.title: Customer support sucks
customer_reviews.text: Had modem for almost a year and now it causes internet to drop every hour. Customer support makes you pay a fee before they even investigate whats wrong with it. They do not replace if faulty without this fee. Will not buy netgear again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mckenzie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Previously we had just been using the standard modem that came with our ISP, as they didn't allow for people to use their own modem until earlier this year. We lucked out with getting this modem on sale and and definitely had better specs than what we had at the time. It was super easy to set up and use. Works like a dream! I sill definitely be recommending this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wolf & W. Schrader

customer_reviews.title: I expected this item to work for more than a month.  I was wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I received this item on Feb 12, 2019. My internet provider came to determine why my internet had not been working since March 20, 2019. It was determined that it was because my new modem was not working properly. Just over a month - now I’m renting a modem from the service provider again. Will try to get my money back for this item. I’ll update this review once I find out how well they handle the refund of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Geller

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I like netgear but unfortunately this modem is not acceptable. Quit working after 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N.

customer_reviews.title: Last time - Cisco.  This time - Netgear.  Next time - Netgear.
customer_reviews.text: This modem was 1,000 times simpler that installing the Cisco. As soon as it was installed (which took a very short time), there was a noticeable improvement in response time. Download speeds increased from 85Mbps to 211 Mbps. The Cisco router is 3 years old and the technology has improved dramatically in the past 3 years. Apps that would not stream on my Roku now run with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: M. Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem very Fast Speeds
customer_reviews.text: Modem connects to my Xfinity with no issues and fast speeds. Would buy again...
customer_reviews.author: Budd W

customer_reviews.title: Don't Believe Claim
customer_reviews.text: Amazon claims this modem is compatible with all cable companies. It's not! I use RCN and the cable does not fit the port. This is the same cable used by Time Warner. Calling Netgear does not help. First they told me it was defective and Amazon sent me another. Both have the same "defective" port. I spent hours on the phone with Netgear and they still say it is compatible. Liars!
customer_reviews.author: TonyNYC

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this modem if you want something for your home ...
customer_reviews.text: No problems with this modem at all. It connected very quickly and authorized to Xfinity with no problem. It took all of maybe 10 minutes to get it up and running. I have always had Netgear products and they last forever and I have had no problems at all. The only reason I purchased this on is because Xfinity has updated speeds and this one will handle the additional speeds. Well worth the price which is very reasonable. I highly recommend this modem if you want something for your home that is reliable and quick.
customer_reviews.author: Xdoormat

customer_reviews.title: Very simple plug and play. Significant speed improvement versus previous modem, Netgear CM400.
customer_reviews.text: Got it today. Very simple plug and play. Significant speed improvement versus previous modem, Netgear CM400. More details: 1. Connected coax cable, turned on, plugged Ethernet to computer, went to ISP (Comcast) website to activate successfully. 2. Unplugged Ethernet from computer, reset modem and router, plugged Ethernet from modem to router. 3. Saw higher speed everywhere throughout the house. Internet plan is 250 Mbps and speed tests show speed range of ~150 - 210 Mbps. (150 is in the basement. It used to be ~40-80 Mbps with previous modem, Netgear CM400).
customer_reviews.author: dawud tan

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet port stopped working within a week + flimsy, but fast.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this modem. With how the ports are ordered and how extremely lightweight it is, it ends up being unstable and falls over. The ethernet port also stopped working after 4 days despite many attempts to fix it. It does reboot quite quickly when restarted, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kzzephyr

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure what I was getting into with a sub $100 modem that claims the speeds it does but so far this thing has been rock solid. I was hesitant because the standard warranty is less than other competitors around the same price point, but ease of accessibility and not having to wait I guess counters that negative. Overall I’m extremely satisfied by this modem. It’s given me every bit if not more speed than what I pay for. Truly impressed. Would highly recommend this modem, and definitely will buy Netgear products in the future. Have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Horrible piece of junk, failed out of the box and waiting too long for replacement from Amazon! DO NIT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Berry

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY- BAD CHIPSET
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem around 8 months ago, and it worked great for a while. However, the past month has been a nightmare. Constantly dropping internet connection, constant packet loss throughout the day, and constant high latency. That's what you will get with this modem eventually. The chipset this modem ships with is known to cause exactly those issues! What a joke for such a pricey modem. Wish the problem would have shown itself while I could have still refunded it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: works for 100MBs Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: activation/installation: takes some time - just be patient, and it will get activated. speed: 100MBs plan - when connected to computer delivers 115MBs. 1st day of use: so far, so good. will update if something goes wrong down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Magnetostatic

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Cable Modem CM700 - Compatible with all Cable Providers including Xfinity by Comcast, Spectrum, Cox | For Cable Plans Up to 500 Mbps | DOCSIS 3.0
product_meta.description: Style:500Mbps Max Download| Pattern Name:SingleThe NETGEAR CM700 High Speed Cable Modem provides a connection to high-speed cable Internet with speeds up to 1.4 Gbps. It is CableLabs certified DOCSIS 3.0 and provides up to 32 times faster than DOCSIS 2.0 devices. The Gigabit Ethernet port provides faster access and downloads. CableLabs DOCSIS 3.0 certified to work with all the major cable Internet providers like XFINITY from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox and more.SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS : Microsoft Windows 7, 8, 10, Vista , XP, 2000, Mac OS, or other operating systems running a TCP/IP network . Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0, Safari 1.4, or Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher. Check that you are using the 12 VDC, 1A power adapter from NETGEAR.
feature_bullets: Compatible with all major cable internet providers: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast, COX, and Spectrum. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service.
Save monthly rental fees: Model CM700 replaces your cable modem saving you up to $168/yr in equipment rental fees.
Built for super-fast speed: best for cable provider plans up to 500 mbps speed.
Works with any wifi router: Connect any WiFi router to this modem's ethernet port to support all your wireless devices.
Ethernet connections: 1 Gigabit Ethernet port connects to your computer or separate WiFi router.
Modem technology: Engineered with 32x8 channel bonding and DOCSIS 3.0.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars16,540 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
